We invest in people, and sometimes as we're investing in people, we say, is it working? The parent-child relationship, we think about this truth of investing and we think of it biologically from that relationship, but I want you to think about it spiritually when you see some younger believers that are growing in their walk with God, that are maybe entering into a time of discussion with you by sharing with you what God is doing in their life and how God has answered prayer for them this particular week and how they were reading this portion of Scripture and God showed me this truth, but as I was reading this portion of Scripture, God showed me this, but then there was this thing over here that I just didn't understand. Most times, I'm stuck at I was reading my Bible and I'm rejoicing, honestly, and say, I just don't understand exactly what God is saying here. Can you help me? Surely, but how encouraging it is when you're investing in someone and you're seeing that growth. See, because ultimately, the goal, as we've mentioned already, as we've started this study this morning and then this evening, the goal is clearly stated in First Thessalonians 2.12, that ye would walk worthy of God who hath called you unto his kingdom and glory. He repeats it in chapter four in verse number one, furthermore then. we beseech you, brethren, and exhort you by the Lord Jesus, that as ye have received of us how ye ought to walk and to please God, so ye would abound more and more." As we think about this two-part message, I asked the question this morning, to whom are you imparting biblical truth? To whom are you imparting biblical truth? Is there someone, maybe someones, several individuals, that you can name, you can see their faces in your mind right now, that I'm imparting biblical truth to these individuals? You know, in order to impart biblical truth, we need to know biblical truth. I can't teach somebody something I don't know. Just can't do it. There's some things that just fly, you don't want my help with. You got a particular project at home, you need a car fixed and worked on, I can give you a name and a number, but you don't want me working on it, you understand. To whom are we imparting biblical truth? How many people would observe you, would see you and say, they're modeling biblical truth. Their behavior reveals what they believe. To whom are we modeling biblical truth? And then this evening as we look at these three thoughts, how's our prayer time? Intercessory prayer, praying for our children, praying for growing believers, being aware of the battles in which they're facing, being aware of the attacks of the enemy. I pray that you'd help us guide us and direct us, and we'll thank you for it. Would you stand?
